results.purpose: Pet food subscription pricing strategy and model for TPT (The Pet Table), defining pricing principles, competitive positioning, and margin optimization across different product plans
key_data_points: Max freezer fill: 1/3 of small NYC apartment freezer
Fresh plan: Match TFD (The Farmer's Dog) prices excluding shipping
Mixed plan: 5-15% below Fresh depending on size and margins
Topper plan: 55-62.5% of Fresh price for 50% of product
Dry plan: Lowest price at 38% margins
Same product quantity = same price principle
PC2 (Product Contribution 2) margins monitored across all plans

entities.name: TPT (The Pet Table)
entities.context: Pet food subscription service being priced

entities.name: TFD (The Farmer's Dog)
entities.context: Primary competitor for Fresh plan pricing benchmark

entities.name: Ollie
entities.context: Competitor mentioned for Fresh price testing

entities.name: Fresh
entities.context: Headline product plan, priced to match TFD

entities.name: Topper
entities.context: Partial meal plan, 55-62.5% of Fresh price

entities.name: Dry/Air Dried
entities.context: Lowest price point plan at 38% margins

entities.name: Pantry Fresh
entities.context: Referenced as positioning consideration for Mixed pricing

insights: Pricing strategy follows 6-step methodology: import costs → benchmark competitors → create scenarios → smooth pricing → check margins → create price steps
Architecture prioritizes consistency: same food quantity always costs the same across SKUs

Price testing focuses on three areas: architecture issues (price per lb curves, margin consistency), competitor positioning (lower entry points), and customer segmentation (incentivizing larger dogs with higher ROI)
Fresh plan serves as anchor/headline price with other plans positioned relative to it
Shipping strategy separates box price from delivery cost, with first order free to reduce acquisition friction
Margin optimization (PC2) and ROI are key constraints, with prices adjusted upward where margins were initially low
Target market expansion through lower Air Dried entry price to increase TAM (Total Addressable Market)
Larger dogs prioritized through more aggressive pricing to capture higher ROI customer segment

results.doc_title: [VIEW ONLY] F_ Meal & Add On Database
results.purpose: Meal planning and recipe database for a meal delivery service tracking nutritional information, costs, ratings, dietary attributes, and operational details

entities.name: Chicken & Mushroom Marsala
entities.context: Multiple recipe variants (F00002A-F) in 'Graveyard' status with garlic mashed cauliflower

entities.name: Garlic Tomato Cream Shredded Beef
entities.context: New recipe (F01908A) with Parmesan polenta, approved 10/21/2025

entities.name: Ají Verde Turkey
entities.context: New recipe (F01912A) with creamed corn, pending approval, 10/28/2025

entities.name: Tomato Caper Salmon Power Bowl
entities.context: New recipe (F01928A) with highest cost ($4.17) and rating (3.51), Mediterranean cuisine

entities.name: Ginger Sesame Chicken & Scallion Rice
entities.context: New Asian recipe (F01932A) with lowest calories (340) and cost ($2.12)

entities.name: SH
entities.context: Chef's initials for beef and turkey recipes

entities.name: MJ
entities.context: Chef's initials for ginger sesame chicken

insights: Multiple recipe variants exist for same meal (Chicken & Mushroom Marsala has 6 versions A-F) with slight cost and nutritional variations
Graveyard status meals are being phased out while new recipes are being introduced
Dietary attributes heavily tracked: Keto, Calorie Smart, High Protein, Dairy Free, GLP-1 Balance, Mediterranean
Protein types vary: Chicken breast, shredded beef, sliced turkey, salmon filet, diced chicken
Cuisine diversity: European/Italian, North American/Southwestern, Asian/Chinese, Greek
New recipes pending approval with dates in October-November 2025
Cost efficiency varies significantly: lowest $1.94 (Chicken Marsala variant) to highest $4.85 (Salmon)
Salmon recipe has highest swap rate (1.01%) and rating (3.51), suggesting premium positioning
All meals use specific container types (1 CT, 2 CT, 3 CT) and color-coded sleeves (Yellow, Red, Blue)
Cooking methods tracked in detail: Grill, Oven, Braiser, Hotel Pan, with preparation steps like Marinade/Brine
